Sometimes JIT (Just-In-Time) compiler compiles the source code into machine code to speed up the execution.

item.title: REST API vs GraphQL
item.description: REST API Vs. GraphQL When it comes to API design, REST and GraphQL each have their own strengths and weaknesses. REST - Uses standard HTTP methods like GET, POST, PUT, DELETE for CRUD operations. - Works well when you need simple, uniform interfaces between separate services/applications. - Caching strategies are straightforward to implement. - The downside is it may require multiple roundtrips to assemble related data from separate endpoints.
